title: Symbolic derivative of a composite function

content.question: If <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mi>d</mi> <mrow> <mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4158@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and if h(x) = x2, then <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mi>d</mi> <mrow> <mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mi>h</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4204@</annotation> </semantics> </math>

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the classification of a given expression (e.g., Use the chain rule to find the derivative of a composite function).
